comments.body: we usually use `${FOO:-default}` but this will default in the set-but-null case. We need `${FOO-default}` here (which will not override set-but-empty) so you can get the previous behavior with `KUBE_RACE=""` from the commandline/env/...

make this the code comment?
or add a link to https://wiki.bash-hackers.org/syntax/pe#use_a_default_value?

I tried to not make this overly verbose, hopefully future editor will think twice before changing, we have history to point back here / reviewers should check that the result is sane.

it will also break CI if done wrong (which is why this PR took so long)

comments.body:
I don't see us setting up a GOBIN / adding it to path anywhere (am I forgetting this happening in one of the sourced files?)

We want to avoid clobbering the system installed copy and usually have a GOBIN under _output like:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/792b4b1e32394a13c27741f71f14dd134d663a5f/hack/verify-govet-levee.sh#L30-L31

> We want to avoid clobbering the system installed copy

this only runs if we can't find `gotestsum` in the path already

kube::golang::setup_env (called at the top of this file) sets GOPATH and clears GOBIN, so go install goes under `_output/local/go/bin`
we can probably dedupe this in other files then, but not in this PR ðŸ™ƒ

comments.body: why is this *? this should be @?

The following failure was detected after modifying other parts. So, I changed this to "*".
```
In ./hack/make-rules/test.sh line 350:
        ${testargs[@]:+${testargs[@]}} \
        ^----------------------------^ SC2145: Argument mixes string and array. Use * or separate argument.
```
a space seperated string is wrong for `args` unless we're doing an eval, which we are not
agh this code is hard to read here, so we're running this inside of a large `bash -c` (we should really reconsider that), `*` is fine in that case.

This part may not be able to run properly with testargs[@].

my result with `bash -x` is here.

- original code (testargs[@])
```
$ sudo PATH=$PATH KUBE_COVER=y make test-cmd
...
+ xargs '-I{}' -n 1 -P 4 bash -c 'set -o pipefail; _pkg="$0"; _pkg_out=${_pkg//\//_};
                                ^^^ **start quote**
  go test --timeout 600s -cover -covermode="atomic" -coverprofile="/tmp/k8s_coverage/d431ed5f68ae4ddf888439fb96b687a923412204/20190426-152616/${_pkg}/coverage.out"
  "${_pkg}" --kubeadm-path' '/home/user/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cluster/kubeadm.sh       | tee        | grep ".*"' '{}'
                         ^^^ **end quote**
can't load package: package /home/user/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cluster/kubeadm.sh       | tee        | grep ".*": import "/home/user/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cluster/kubeadm.
sh       | tee        | grep \".*\"": cannot import absolute path
+ test_result=123
```

- testargs[*]
```
+ xargs '-I{}' -n 1 -P 4 bash -c 'set -o pipefail; _pkg="$0"; _pkg_out=${_pkg//\//_};
                                ^^^ **start quote**
  go test --timeout 600s -cover -covermode="atomic" -coverprofile="/tmp/k8s_coverage/d431ed5f68ae4ddf888439fb96b687a923412204/20190426-152739/${_pkg}/coverage.out"
  "${_pkg}" --kubeadm-path /home/user/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cluster/kubeadm.sh       | tee        | grep ".*"' '{}'
ok      k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/kubeadm/test/cmd  20.339s coverage: 45.8% of statements                          ^^^ **end quote**
+ test_result=0
```
This is local only and doesn't affect what is actually built, correct?
@liggitt yup, that's 100% correct. It is just used for determining whether the path the user is trying to test is valid.
@sttts what does this do in context?

it forces grep to consider output it might otherwise think is binary as text, so that it outputs the actual match instead of just saying "binary file matched".  Since it's just test output, we should never have *actual* binary junk, just stuff that grep incorrectly assumes is binary.
I hit this when debugging a fuzzer failure -- it thought the fuzzer output was binary, and so it just truncated the results of the test output
